intro: Chromolaena farinosa, commonly known as the stinging nettle shrub, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of the Americas. It is a member of the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its hairy stems and serrated leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers that are clustered in heads, typical of the daisy family. It is known for its ability to thrive in disturbed soils and is often found in open areas such as roadsides and pastures. Chromolaena farinosa is also noted for its stinging hairs, which can cause skin irritation upon contact.
